div1.head: Letter from George W. Baird to [s.n.] Carter, October 29, 1900
div1.opener:
G.B.
Col. B.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
PAYMASTER GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Office of Chief Disbursing Officer,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
October 29, 1900.
Col. Carter:
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to paragraph 25, Special Order 246, c.s., will it
be practicable for you to address a letter to Dr. Read, bearing date
October 19, so modifying the order named as to direct him to report
back at Washington? I understand that it was the desire of the Sur-
geon General that the order should so be issued and that the Doctor
has made the journey accordingly. His proper station at this time,
I understand to be Columbia Barracks, near Havana, Cuba; and some
question might arise as to the payment of mileage from Indianapolis
via New York back to his proper station.

The difficulty would be obviated by such a letter as I speak of.
If the letter can be written please send it to me as soon as possible
as I have his mileage accounts to settle.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, G.W. Baird- Mr Kohe
